p: In parallel, genetic evidence supports the role of KIRs in flavivirus infection. In studies performed in Gabon, Brazil and Western India, a difference in the frequencies of KIR genes was found in patients infected with DENV, as compared with healthy controls [ 33, 79, 80]. Mechanistically, KIR molecules interact with DENV peptides presented on HLA molecules. As observed in many viral infections [ 81], an interaction was demonstrated between KIR3DL1 and a conserved NS1 peptide of DENV presented by HLA-B57 [ 82]. By contrast, a peptide on the NS3 protein that is conserved in most flaviviruses, including DENV, stabilized HLA-C0102 and interacted with KIR2DS2 resulting in NK cell activation [ 29].
